0.question: Why does rain fall?
0.answer: Rain falls when water droplets in clouds become too heavy to stay suspended in the air and fall to the ground due to gravitational pull. The water droplets come together and form clouds through a process called condensation. When the clouds become saturated with water droplets, they start to collide with each other and grow larger, forming even bigger droplets. Eventually, these larger droplets become heavy enough to fall to the ground as rain.
